content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												I feel guilty giving the thumbs down to what might be a classic to some people but :Pros :Really cool PDF manual. Goes into submarine charts, historical details, indepth controls. This is the kind of manual you kept on hand while playing and constantly referred back to, sprinkle in a bit of roleplay vibe to your game session and there might had been a fun gaming session in that in 1985! It looks like if you put in the the effort the game had the potential to maybe reward you for your effort with some primitive pixelated naval battle action. ConsThe game is mathematics heavy it seems , and even if it worked the UI's reliance on the manual, and the cryptic nature of everything weighs the game down so much that it sinks like a rock right away in my humble opinionThe keyboard controls dont work, and apparently you could play with an old school joystick somehow, I pressed every single key on my keyboard through all 3 game modes and NOTHING happened. The game manual hints at IBM keboard controls located inside the cover of the manual but i dont see that this would help given that I tried everything.Conclusion :More a museum piece than a game, this is a piece for the most hardcore collectors, ultra retro gamers, and bundle hoarders. Everyone else should steer WAY clear.

Posted: April 24, 2016
												Worse game ever, how frustration and worthless. I own and play this on Nintendo. One of the best games ever. Posted to Steam really sucks. Controls (if you can call is that suck) , visual are nothing but dots on a screen where Nintendo Entertainment System puts this to shame. Do not buy this game. I got it cheap on G  2  A cheap and wish I could return the key for my money back.  You can't even use steams normal F12 overlay to show how badly this game sucks. No intro music, game style layout sucks, if I could beat someone in the face for stealing, I would beat that bass ted that uploaded this game to steam. Do ..... Not ....... Purchase .......unless you want to waste your money. I'm really disappointed as I thought I was going to have fun as I did on NES. Grrrrrrr!

Posted: November 25, 2016
												It is hard to really want to review such old classics like SS based on their gameplay as they are from another era and anyone who buys the game should be well aware that this is a vintage gaming experience, which will mean functional graphics and alot of keyboard commands and no mouse - aside from these the game though is still fun and overall complete enough in itself to  be worthwhile.Silent Service 2 is much nicer and updated version of the first game but the first one still has its charm The only criticism i would have is that the version offered here is the dos version of SIlent Service. This is fine enough but the much better version was to be found on the aminge and there are some good amiga emulators out there now
